author: mfuninsun
title: Overdue for Rehab
text:
We are Hilton Honors guests. Family of 4. We stayed 7 nights in March 2017. Upgraded to a Jr Suite.
Pros
Great downtown location - just across street from Ground Zero and very close to subway, restaurants, shopping, etc
Staff were kind and helpful, esp to kids
Our one in-room dining experience was pretty good
JR suite views and layout were good for a family of 4
Kids loved the pool
Cons
The JR suite was badly in need of rehab: grungy, worn, frayed and stained carpet, stained couch cushions, peeling wallpaper, rusty bathroom fixtures, light bulbs out in bathroom vanity, dirty grout, and worst of all stained sheets on bed! Ugh! Even the TV screen was super dirty. We are not very picky but it was BAAD. We complained and asked to be moved (we were there with our young children after all) but the other room offered had similar issues. My wife, who stays in this location often said the regular King rooms are not quite as bad in terms of wear and tear.
Other thing we didn't like is that there is STILL construction at Ground Zero, which starts before 7am, 6 days a week and is VERY loud. (This is clearly not the hotels fault but it's a factor to consider).
Room Tip: Great views from JR suites, east/south facing would be quieter vs west/north See more room tips
